reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed last Saturday night in a king room with no view (which we knew going in). This is the old Grayl's Hotel which was gutted and completely renovated. It's beautiful. Cost approx. $260 including tax plus $18 per night for valet parking. Over night self parking isn't much of an option in this area. Their primary focus is the bar/restaurant and wildly popular roof top lounge. We stay in St. Pete on a Sat night 4-5 times a year. I wouldn't rule out returning but there are some things they could do that would really improve the stay for me. Put a safe in the room. Put bath robes in the bathroom. Do something about the lighting in the bathroom--I had trouble seeing to shave and it's really dark in the shower. Bathroom is very nice in décor though--free standing tub and separate shower. There are only 18 rooms on 2 floors. Please put an ice machine on one of the floors. The front desk will get ice for you but they do double duty and aren't always there and with a total renovation an accessible machine should have been placed. Put a mini-fridge in the room--there is plenty of space. A ceiling fan over the bed would be nice. None of these are complete deal breakers but they would make a nice property really, really nice.
reviews.title: Nice, and could be a lot nicer

reviews.text: Celebrated my birthday at Birchwood and it was amazing . The rooftop lounge is beautiful and you can see the pier and part of downtown . Parking is a problem in downtown st pete so I parked at the pier and walk to Birchwood . The servers were prompt and courteous . The restaurant had a small dining place and I would recommend making a reservation beforehand . The food was amazing and the prices were reasonable too. I would highly recommend this place for a fun nightout .
reviews.title: Awesome rooftop lounge and restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Was treated to a night at The Birchwood this weekend. We had noticed it under construction when staying in the area earlier this year and I was surprised it was all finished and opened. It is a beautiful property, the management and employees were all extremely friendly and bent over backwards to make our stay pleasant and memorable. The room was gorgeous, the bedding very comfortable and plush. The bathroom was also gorgeous and everything was very clean. The complimentary breakfast was "okay" - some parts were excellent (fresh OJ, good "home baked" style bread for toast, really good coffee and marmalade) and then some not so much (scrambled eggs that looked like they had sat in the chafing dish for hours yet also looked like no one had touched them before us, and no butter to be found). The Canopy lounge is outstanding, the appetizers and drinks we had were top-shelf, the service was excellent. Only negatives for us were that we could not get our own ice (had to ask the front desk to bring a bucket to the room) and although the room ambiance was wonderful, once we really needed a light to see to fix the in-room coffee pot, we discovered the lightening was awful, without the curtains open and daylight, the few lights in the room were more for decor than to provide real light to see by. Also wished for some comfortable seating, only one small chair in the room that was also designed more to look good than to use for seating. Otherwise, it is a beautiful place and worth the splurge, we would stay there again (just would bring a flashlight!)
reviews.title: Nice Night at the Birchwood

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed at Birchwood this past week and I must say that I am impressed. From the moment we arrived, we felt welcome. The hotel and restaurant are just beautiful.
reviews.title: The Jewel of St. Petersburg

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arrival, check-in was friendly and efficient. Eddie at the front desk was very helpful and professional. Parking was across the street. You can unload in front of the hotel and park the car yourself, or the staff will take it for you.
reviews.title: A landmark is reborn

reviews.text: Although the Birchwood had only been open a short time and there were some problems, the staff was very helpful and quick to respond to the problems. The rooms are very nice and roomy and the continental breakfast was good. The hotel is within walking distance to most things in downtown St. Pete and is pretty much the hub of the nightlife. The rooftop bar is only accessible from the outside of the building and ensures the privacy of the guests which is another plus.
reviews.title: Downtown St. Pete

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow! what a nice looking building from the street. Shoot, even from the roof, the property is beautiful.
reviews.title: Great Curb Appeal - downhill from there

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for an anniversary recently and best I can say is this hotel needs some time to work out the kinks. Service was well intended, but fell well below the mark.
reviews.title: Best Beach Drive Secret

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm thinking summer of 2014 would be a good time to try again. I really hope this place gets it together because it really is a nice looking place.
reviews.title: wE ONLY TRIED THE RESTAURANT, NOT THE HOTEL, BUT IT WAS FABULOUS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: P.S. need to get Valet - you can ask people to pay that kind of money and then tell them to park at a lot by the museum.
reviews.title: 39th birthday night out on the town.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food is excellent,loved the BBQ ribs as an appetizer and plan to go back for dinner and steaks.The roof top lounge area is very unique and will get really busy when the weather gets cooler.The Birchwood is a real gem,enjoy.
reviews.title: A Paradise for Two
